name: places/ChIJp0kvLbtYwokRt7vR7h9kgZQ
formattedAddress: 232 E 89th St #3W, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 232 E 89th St #3W, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text:
Hamperville markets itself as a premium laundry service, offering a key promise: door-to-door delivery within a defined 2-hour window. Regrettably, the actual service deviates considerably from this pledge, with Hamperville persistently failing to meet these fundamental service terms.

The key issues are two-fold. Firstly, deliveries frequently arrive 2-4 hours outside of the scheduled window. Secondly, the assurance of door-to-door service is often neglected, with laundry left with third parties or in unattended hallways without the customer's approval.

These are not rare, isolated incidents. They indicate a systematic disparity between the paid-for service and the service delivered. Despite commanding a premium fee for a specific offering, the actual service feels more like an 'anytime, anyplace' delivery that prioritizes the company's convenience over adherence to their advertised terms.

When these service failures are brought to their attention, Hamperville diverts blame onto external factors, such as traffic. A case in point was a delivery scheduled for 7-9 PM that ended up being made at 3 PM, a deviation that Hamperville attributed to traffic - an explanation that logically falls flat. Rather than owning up to their service shortcomings, Hamperville seems to expect customers to adapt to their timetable, even providing an ultimatum: either put up with the inconsistent service at a premium price or find an alternative provider. This indicates a lack of intent to provide the service as advertised or make improvements.

Given these challenges, I suggest that Hamperville focus on the following areas:
- Upholding Service Terms: honor to door-to-door delivery within the agreed-upon 2-hour window.
- Obtaining Consent: If there are any changes in delivery timing or location, seek customer approval first and offer to reschedule if permission is not granted to show up at a different time.
- Demonstrating Accountability: Rather than attributing service failures to uncontrollable external factors, take responsibility for any service lapses.
- Reviewing Pricing: If you are unable to consistently deliver on the terms of service customer are paying for, you likely should consider updating your pricing to reflect the service you are actually providing as well as the terms advertised on your website to avoid misleading customers and setting expectations you cannot meet.

In conclusion, Hamperville's actual service delivery fails to match its appealing advertisements. To ensure customer satisfaction and maintain trust, it's vital that Hamperville align their service delivery with the promises they make.

originalText.text: These guys offer a good service laundry comes back immaculate and nicely organized (even though I throw my stuff in that bag in a real hurry a lot of the time ðŸ˜³). If you email or call customer service they call you back or email back pretty much instantly in my experience. They have also customized pick up times for me beyond what's offered on their app, when I've been going on vacation for example - I just emailed and asked. The drivers who pick up and drop off are very polite. I've sent comforters and pillows which have come back in great shape also.

originalText.text:
The wash service is not terrible, but is considerably worse than if you do it yourself. The pick-up and delivery was on time to begin with but eventually started showing up late to every appointment, sometimes by more than an hour. When I call there is never anyone there to answer the phone, it is just an answering machine and they never return calls. After the second email I sent I eventually got a response (over a day later) and instead of apologizing they told me that I should give them a copy of my building key (which is not allowed by my lease) so that they can leave my laundry in the building and I don't have to wait for them.

Hamperville just does not understand the bare minimum of customer service. I understand they are probably busy. I just wanted some notice that they will be late and some acknowledgement that they are trying to be on time. I would rather walk my laundry to a company that actually tries to do the job well. Everyone makes mistakes but if you can't even pretend to care then you don't deserve anyone's business.

originalText.text: Really fast and very reasonably priced dry cleaner in the city. Moving here from out of state I was shocked to find the cost of dry cleaning twice or even triple to my previous home and then it would take up to a week or more on top of that with most dry cleaners in the area. One Stop is fast, sometimes next day fast, not in the weekend unfortunatelty, and they donâ€™t charge the crazy prices most other cleaners do, espesialy if you a subscriber.  Most importantly everything comes out looking perfect. Customers service is aslo very promt and helpfull. Looking for a great dry cleaner? Look no further than these guys, in very please with the service and efficiency.

originalText.text:
DO NOT USE Hamperville unless you are OK with melted and broken bras, melted beading and embellishments, grey looking whites,  colour stained clothes and MAJOR shrinkage!! I was visiting NY and did not have access to a washing machine so I used Hamperville. I was very specific about wanting like colours washed together, included colour catching paper to be used and even let them know that I was willing to pay extra for this service.
I was left devastated with most of the load picked up ruined, including new items purchased during the holiday.
When I contacted Hamperville they simply said that they held no responsibility for any of this damage!
Very poor!
